body_html:
There’s been a lot of PRs around this functionality and while we don’t really like it, I think it’s ok to add a strict argument (True by default), which if set to False allow the dicts to have arbitrary mismatches.

I know your solution is safer, but it probably won’t stop the flood of issues and PRs, and I don’t want to have 20 modes of loading 😕 If you want to implement that then please go ahead, otherwise I’ll send a PR sometime later
body_text:
There’s been a lot of PRs around this functionality and while we don’t really like it, I think it’s ok to add a strict argument (True by default), which if set to False allow the dicts to have arbitrary mismatches.
I know your solution is safer, but it probably won’t stop the flood of issues and PRs, and I don’t want to have 20 modes of loading 😕 If you want to implement that then please go ahead, otherwise I’ll send a PR sometime later
body:
There’s been a lot of PRs around this functionality and while we don’t really like it, I think it’s ok to add a strict argument (True by default), which if set to False allow the dicts to have arbitrary mismatches.

I know your solution is safer, but it probably won’t stop the flood of issues and PRs, and I don’t want to have 20 modes of loading :confused: If you want to implement that then please go ahead, otherwise I’ll send a PR sometime later
